oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Beauford Delaney Collection
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Beauford Delaney
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Beauford Delaney (December 30, 1901 – March 26, 1979) was an American modernist painter, known for for his work with the Harlem Renaissance in the 1930's and 1940's,.He moved to Paris in the 1950's and worked with abstract expressionism. The collection includes his letters to his brother Samuel Emery Delaney in Knoxville. There is a 1983 condolence note to Ougust Delaney Stewart of Knoxville from Beauford's friends Dolly and Al Hirschfeld. Incomplete letter (no other pages or envelope).
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Artists; Families; Correspondence;
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Incomplete letter (no other pages or envelope).
